title: Papua New Guinea police say 4 being held by criminals
description: Papua New Guinea’s police commissioner says security forces are prepared to use lethal force to free a foreign national and three citizens of the South Pacific island nation from armed criminals

title: China’s economic recovery hinges on consumers. They’re not spending.
description: Beijing was betting on a wave of "revenge spending" as Chinese consumers emerged from three years of zero-covid restrictions. It hasn't happened.

title: Biden in Kyiv and Warsaw is a reminder of who really leads Europe
description: The trip makes clear the centrality of the United States — and in particular, of the Biden administration — in leading Europe’s defense.

title: Deaths from jihadi attack on Burkina Faso army rise to 51
description: Burkina Faso’s military says the death toll from a jihadi attack on a Burkina Faso army unit in the north of the country last week has risen to 51, after 43 new bodies were found

title: Egypt unveils renovated wing of oldest museum, new papyrus
description: Egypt’s ministry of tourism and antiquities has unveiled a newly renovated wing of its oldest museum

title: Syrian president visits Oman in 1st trip abroad since quake
description: Syrian President Bashar Assad has visited the Gulf nation of Oman on his first official visit since the deadly Feb. 6 quake

title: New earthquake causes further devastation in Turkey, Syria
description: A new 6.4 magnitude earthquake has struck parts of Turkey and Syria that were laid waste two weeks ago by a massive quake that killed around 45,000 people

title: Newborn saved from earthquake in Syria adopted by her aunt
description: A baby girl who was born under the rubble of her family’s earthquake-shattered home has left the hospital and gone to her new home

title: U.K. police confirm body in river is Nicola Bulley
description: British police on Monday said a body pulled from the River Wyre in northwest England on Sunday was missing mother Nicola Bulley, the subject of a high-profile search.

title: ‘We had hope’: Antakya residents left to dig out themselves and their dead
description: The historic city of Antakya was among the places most ravaged by the earthquakes that struck Turkey and Syria. But many residents said they were left to dig out on their own.

title: Another strong quake hits Turkey-Syria border
description: A strong earthquake rattled southern Turkey and northern Syria late Monday, sparking panic in a region devasted two weeks ago by powerful temblors that ripped through cities and towns and have killed more than 46,000 people.

title: UN Council OKs watered-down statement on Israel settlements
description: The U.N. Security Council has unanimously approved a watered-down statement strongly opposing Israel’s continued construction and expansion of settlements

title: Some Anglican bishops reject leader Welby over gay marriage
description: Several Anglican bishops from Africa, Asia, Latin America and the Pacific say they no longer recognize Archbishop of Canterbury Justin Welby as their leader

title: Brazil deluge kills 36; search continues for dozens missing
description: Hundreds of rescuers in Brazil are searching for survivors of landslides and flooding that killed at least 36 people along the coast of the country’s southern state of Sao Paulo following a huge weekend downpour

title: Former Dutch queen Beatrix breaks wrist in skiing accident
description: The Dutch Royal House says that Princess Beatrix, the 85-year-old former Dutch queen, has undergone surgery after breaking her wrist in a skiing accident

title: Putin may meet top Chinese party official on Moscow trip
description: The Kremlin says Russian President Vladimir Putin could meet with the Chinese Communist Party’s foreign policy chief in the Russian capital

title: Revelers enjoy Carnival street parades across Germany
description: Hundreds of thousands of revelers have taken to the streets of Germany to celebrate Carnival dressed up in colorful costumes, amid an abundance of candy, flowers and alcohol

title: Madagascar, Mozambique set for "dangerous" Cyclone Freddy
description: A cyclone which is intensifying as it approaches the southeastern African coast has been labeled as “dangerous” by the United Nation’s weather agency on Monday as nations brace for landfall

title: Bahrain charges religious reformers with questioning Islam
description: The Gulf nation of Bahrain plans to put three religious reformers on trial for allegedly questioning the foundations of Islam

title: High February temperatures have India already bracing for more heat waves
description: Last year India had the hottest summer on record, this year the heat alerts are starting even earlier.

title: Swedish king is doing well after surgery in 'heart area'
description: Sweden’s King Carl XVI Gustaf is doing well after undergoing a planned surgical procedure “in the heart area.”

title: Key developments in the aftermath of the Turkey, Syria quake
description: The Turkish disaster management agency, AFAD, has raised the number of confirmed fatalities from the earthquake in Turkey to 41,156

title: Israel promises not to approve additional West Bank outposts
description: Israel has told the Biden administration it will rein in the approval of new West Bank settlement outposts

title: Collection of rare centuries-old jewelry returns to Cambodia
description: A spectacular collection of centuries-old Cambodian jewelry has been returned to the Southeast Asian country, the latest treasures to be retrieved from the estate of well-known antiquities collector and dealer Douglas Latchford, who was accused of buying and selling looted artifacts

title: EU targets more Iran officials, organizations over crackdown
description: The European Union has imposed sanctions on 32 Iranians, including the culture and education ministers, intelligence officials and lawmakers accused of links to the security crackdown on protesters

title: Russian pranksters call Merkel posing as Ukraine's ex-leader
description: Russian pranksters posing as Ukraine’s ex-President Petro Poroshenko managed to contact Angela Merkel by phone to discuss developments in Ukraine and Belarus, although the former German chancellor appeared wary during the call

title: Rape trial of Moroccan singer Saad Lamjarred starts in Paris
description: The aggravated rape and assault trial of Moroccan singer Saad Lamjarred has started in Paris

title: 'People's court' tries Vladimir Putin for war in Ukraine
description: A “people’s court” is putting Russian President Vladimir Putin on trial for the crime of aggression over his invasion of Ukraine, in a symbolic move to close an “accountability gap” in the absence of an international tribunal with jurisdiction

title: Rattled by China, U.S. and allies are beefing up defenses in the Pacific
description: The U.S. military is partnering with Asian allies to deter Beijing from invading Taiwan, but “everything needs to go faster,” says Indo-Pacific command’s top general.

title: Bulgaria: 43 migrants found in van days after 18 found dead
description: Bulgarian police say they have discovered 43 migrants, including ten children, hidden in a van in the west of the country

title: Biden makes surprise trip to Ukraine ahead of Russian invasion anniversary
description: President Biden appeared in Kyiv, the Ukrainian capital, ahead of a planned trip to Poland -- a high-risk visit that offered the strongest show of Washington's support.

title: Taiwan drops indoor mask mandate in restaurants, offices
description: Three years into the global pandemic, Taiwan says people no longer have to wear masks at all times indoors though it is still keeping some restrictions in place

title: Pakistan, Afghan Taliban trade fire at border crossing
description: Officials say Pakistani border guards and Afghan Taliban forces have exchanged fire at a key border crossing in northwestern Pakistan

title: Leiji Matsumoto, creator of 'Space Battleship Yamato,' dies
description: Leiji Matsumoto, the anime creator known for ”Space Battleship Yamato” and other classics, has died at age 85

title: Ukraine live briefing: Pressure over F-16 jets builds ahead of Biden’s Poland trip
description: President Biden is set to travel to Poland this week to discuss Western efforts to help Ukraine, as pressure builds on his administration to provide Kyiv with F-16 fighters.

title: High-risk volcano search for Philippine plane with 4 onboard
description: Philippine aviation officials say they are investigating whether the wreckage of a small plane spotted near the crater of a restive volcano is that of a Cessna aircraft, which went missing over the weekend with four people on board
